pr_title: [RW-3389][risk=no] Avoid increasing query count for each user when fetching Profiles

timeline.message: progress I think. simplified the mapper

timeline.bodyText: nit: I'm not sure the heavy suffix helps clarify anything here. Is this important to a reader, and/or does it map to any well-defined concept or pattern in the codebase?
timeline.author: gjuggler

replies.bodyText: We don't have an established convention, but I thought it important to indicate that this set of users had more fields populated than the default DbUser. The convention at HubSpot would be hydratedUsers.
replies.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: Why change this?  The linter-required formatting makes this version harder to follow
timeline.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: I thought lambdas were preferred in this kind of usage and thought you might not have realized you can use a lambda instead of declaring a predicate. Arguably we could improve it by  declaring the list of changes and then taking its size. I believe  IntelliJ suggested this change as well.
replies.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText:
Makes sense.  Lambda + separated size check sounds like the best option here.  Thanks.
It's certainly not a priority to make that change.
replies.author: jmthibault79
